text: The arrondissement of Villeneuve-sur-Lot is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Lot-et-Garonne département in the Nouvelle-Aquitaine region. Its capital, and subpréfecture of the department, is the city of Villeneuve-sur- Lot. ==History== When the Lot-et-Garonne department was created on 17 February 1800, the arrondissement of Villeneuve-sur-Lot was part of that original department. ==Geography== The arrondissement of Villeneuve-sur-Lot is in the northeast of Lot-et-Garonne, with an area of , the largest arrondissement of the department. It has 90,527 inhabitants and a population density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement is bordered to the north by the Dordogne department, to the east by the Lot department, to the southeast by the Tarn- et-Garonne department, to the south by the arrondissement of Agen and to the west by the arrondissement of Marmande. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Villeneuve-sur-Lot, there are three cantons where not all their "communes" are in the arrondissement: Le Confluent, Le Pays de Serres and Le Val du Dropt.
